name: market for wheat grain | wheat grain | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21428/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'wheat grain', in the geography of South Africa.;This dataset represents the transport of 1 kg of wheat grain from the farm to the corresponding market, i.e. whole wheat processing facility (dry mill) . No losses are considered in this dataset.;The product 'wheat grain' is a grain. It is an annual crop. The ecoinvent database also contains this product from organic and Swiss integrated production.

The activity starts at the farm gate.

The activity ends with the whole wheat at the mill gate.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: South African values: Not applicable worldwide.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data are intended to reflect current equipment and processes in South Africa.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data is primarily sourced from literature and statistics.

flow.name: wheat grain
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

exchanges.description: Estimated value based on the breakdown of wheat production (DAFF, 2016; SAGIS, 2017a) and whole wheat processed (i.e. dry milling of wheat) (SAGIS, 2017a, SAGIS, 2017b). It was assumed that mills would source wheat grain from within the region first, which amounted to 36% of wheat grain processed. It was further assumed that wheat grain is transported an average distance of 100km within the province. For the remaining wheat grain to be transported to mills in Gauteng (GP), KwaZulu-Natal (KZN), Mpumalanga (MP) and Free State (FS) Provinces a weighted average distance was applied based on a breakdown of the surplus grain available in the other provinces, including imports, and the distance from these regions to the corresponding milling regions. It was assumed that the grain would be imported via Durban.The distances were estimated using Google Maps. Based on SAGIS (2017c), approximately 26% of wheat grain is transported via road, with the remainder being transported via rail. The component transported via conveyor is negligible. It was assumed that the transport within the region is predominantly road, with the longer distances accounted for by rail. Reference(s): DAFF (2016) Wheat Market Value Chain Profile 2016, Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries, Available at: http://www.nda.agric.za/doaDev/sideMenu/Marketing/Annual%20Publications/Commodity%20Profiles/field%20crops/Wheat%20Market%20Value%20Chain%20Profile%20%202016.pdf. (Accessed August 2017); SAGIS (2017a) Supply and Demand: Marketing Year October 2016 to September 2017, South African Grain Information System. Available at: http://www.sagis.org.za/sd_marketing_year.html. (Accessed April 2017); SAGIS (2017b) Processing per Province - May 2015 to April 2016, South African Grain Information System. Available at: http://www.sagis.org.za/processing-per-province.html (Accessed April 2017); Du Toit, C.J.L., Meissner, H.H. & van Niekerk, W.A. (2013) Direct methane and nitrous oxide emissions of South African dairy and beef cattle, South African Journal of Animal Science (43) 320-339; SAGIS (2017c) Grain Transport by Component, South African Grain Information System. Available at: http://www.sagis.org.za/monthly-grain-transport.html. (Accessed October 2017).

For the remaining wheat grain to be transported to mills in Gauteng (GP), KwaZulu-Natal (KZN), Mpumalanga (MP) and Free State (FS) Provinces a weighted average distance was applied based on a breakdown of the surplus grain available in the other provinces, including imports, and the distance from these regions to the corresponding milling regions.
